com.digby.localpoint.sdk.core

Interface ILPMessageProvider


  • public interface ILPMessageProvider
    A message provider acts as a store for messages deemed "relevant" by the SDK.

    A message provider can be used by an application in two ways:

    1. synchronous - The provider can be queried for messages currently known to it.
    2. asynchronous - An application can register a listener that will be notified when messages known are added to, deleted from or modified in the provider.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.1.0

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adds the given listener to this provider.
      void deleteMessage(ILPID id)
      Deletes a message with the given identifier.
      ILPMessageFilterFactory getFilterFactory()
      Returns the message filter factory associated with this provider.
      ILPMessage getMessage(ILPID id)
      Returns a message with the given identifier.

      Returns all messages known to this provider.

      Removes all listeners from this provider.

      Removes the given listener from this provider.

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        void addListener(ILPMessageListener listener)
        Adds the given listener to this provider.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be added (must never be null)

      • getFilterFactory

        ILPMessageFilterFactory getFilterFactory()
        Returns the message filter factory associated with this provider.

        This method should never return null.

        Returns:
        the message filter factory associated with this provider

      • getMessage

        ILPMessage getMessage(ILPID id)
        Returns a message with the given identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the message to be returned (must never be null)

        This function may take a long time, you should not call this method from the application main thread.

        Returns:
        the message with the given identifier if such a message is currently known to this provider; null otherwise

      • deleteMessage

        void deleteMessage(ILPID id)
        Deletes a message with the given identifier.

        This function may take a long time, you should not call this method from the application main thread.

        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the message to be deleted (must never be null)

      • getMessages

        List<ILPMessage> getMessages()
        Returns all messages known to this provider.

        This is equivalent to calling getMessages(ILPFilter, ILPOrdering) with null for both arguments.

        This function may take a long time, you should not call this method from the application main thread.

        Returns:
        the (possibly empty) list of messages known to this provider

      • getMessages

        List<ILPMessage> getMessages(ILPFilter filter,
                           ILPOrdering ordering)
        Returns all messages filtered by the given filter and sorted by the given ordering.

        This function may take a long time, you should not call this method from the application main thread.

        Parameters:
        filter - the filter to be applied to the messages to be returned (if null, acts as a filter that accepts all messages; see ILPMessageFilterFactory.getAllFilter())
        ordering - the ordering to be applied to the messages to be returned (if null, acts as ILPMessageOrderingFactory.getAscendingExpirationOrdering() )
        Returns:
        the (possibly empty) list of messages that satisfy the given filter and ordering

      • getOrderingFactory

        ILPMessageOrderingFactory getOrderingFactory()
        Returns the message ordering factory associated with this provider.

        This method should never return null.

        Returns:
        the message ordering factory associated with this provider

      • removeAllListeners

        void removeAllListeners()
        Removes all listeners from this provider.

      • removeListener

        void removeListener(ILPMessageListener listener)
        Removes the given listener from this provider.

        This method has no effect if the given listener is not registered with this provider.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove (must never be null)
